article:
'Sensitivity' of explosives is the degree to which an explosive can be initiated
by impact, heat, or friction.

Sensitivity, along with stability and brisance are three of the most significant
properties of explosives that affect their use and application. All explosive
compounds have a certain amount of energy required to initiate. If an explosive
is too sensitive, it may go off accidentally. A safer explosive is less
sensitive and will not explode if accidentally dropped or mishandled. However,
such explosives are more difficult to initiate intentionally.
